children.value: Kerberos Enterprise can be installed where Kubernetes can be installed. This means that it can run at the Edge - Baremetal -, in the cloud - VMs - or at Kubernetes service providers - SAAS - such as GCP, Azure, AWS, DigitalOcean, and the list goes on.

Although you might except Kubernetes at the Edge or Kubernetes in the cloud, there are no differences, well sorry to say there are. As Kubernetes service providers implemented features such as LoadBalancers, Persistent Volumes, and others, they have automated and integration a huge portion of the Kubernetes stack with their related PAAS environment. For example if you run a Kubernetes Clusster on GCP, you will use the LoadBalancing and Storage services from GCP, and you don't have to allocate thos services by yourself.
